intro: Barleria montana, commonly known as redstem barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Barleria montana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
